image.altText: Energy Minister Penny Sharpe

props.synopsis: While progress has been made restoring stability to Broken Hill's power supply after wild weather destroyed key infrastructure, the mayor says the community has been "let down".

title.children: Recovery assistance for NSW's far west to begin this week as mayor slams power delays

image.altText: Elderly couple smile, woman in green tee, short grey hair, looks at the man in blue check , stand under a tree, roses behind.

props.synopsis: With more than 450 varieties of roses, this couple has created a thriving oasis, which is considered one of the best open gardens in the Riverland Rose and Garden Festival.

title.children: For 26 years, Lorna and Brad's open garden has drawn admirers. Their love story blossomed even earlier

image.altText: Serious man, shaved head, tattoos on arms leans on boxing ring ropes, wears black tee with Scottie Williams, part man, wolf pic.

props.synopsis: Working as a bouncer in pubs and clubs around Australia, Scottie Williams is no stranger to breaking up scuffles, but he wanted more out of life.

title.children: By their 40s, most boxers have long since retired. So why is this man taking on a dangerous fight?

image.altText: Adelaide United assistant coach Travis Dodd and defender Bailey O'Neil

props.synopsis: The current A-League Men's competition has less than a handful of Indigenous players, but emerging talent Bailey O'Neil and mentor Travis Dodd want to "get that ball rolling" when it comes to improving pathways.

title.children: Bailey O'Neil is one of just three Indigenous players in the A-League Men â€” he hopes to inspire more

image.altText: a man in a business suit walks outside a court building

props.synopsis: A South Australian family says they forgive an Italian tourist whose "terrible error" caused a crash which killed three of their relatives in the state's Mid North last year, and say they do not believe he should be jailed.Â

title.children: Family forgives Italian tourist for 'serious lapse' which caused triple-fatal crash

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair wearing a pink and tan dress leans on a marble kitchen bench smiling and looking off camera.

props.synopsis:
The cook was named Best Host of a TV Format Award at the C21 International Format Awards for the ABC show Maggie Beer's Big Mission, a project aiming to overhaul the aged care industry's dismal catering.Â

title.children: Maggie Beer wins international TV award, beating industry legends Jimmy Kimmel and Stephen Fry

image.altText: A close-up of a bald man wearing glasses, a navy blazer and white shirt.

image.altText: An image of a person driving with a dog on their lap while using their mobile phone.

image.altText: Hainsworth interview

props.synopsis: Steven Hainsworth was arrested in 2019, 21 years after allegedly murdering the first of three victims. He has spent the past two months listening intently to evidence from the Supreme Court dock.

title.children: From arrest to trial, this is how the case of an accused serial killer unfolded

image.altText: Woman speaking into microphone outside parliament house.

props.synopsis: University of Adelaide law academic Joanna Howe has posted to social media labelling female politicians 'baby killers' following a failure to change South Australian abortion laws.

title.children: Anti-abortion activist brands female politicians 'baby killers' in social media post

image.altText: National Guard in riot gear with shields line up in front of the Capitol building at night

props.synopsis: American voters on both sides hate the feedback loop that is creating more polarisation with each election. So why is change so elusive?

title.children: For a country known for its patriotism, Americans really hate their own democracy

image.altText: Israeli flag and Iran flag seen together.

props.synopsis: This round of fighting between Israel and Iran might be over, but the rules have changed and things are increasingly dangerous.

title.children: Israel and Iran have stopped firing, but they have moved closer to all-out war

image.altText: night shot of city lights with tower on left side

props.synopsis: Iran says it is "obligated to defend itself" after four soldiers were killed in Israeli air strikes.

image.altText: Hands on a black jacket with a NSW Police patch

title.children: 'He spat in my face': Former NSW Police sergeant alleges 'horrific' homophobia during career

image.altText: Woman bending down in a field of vegetables growing

props.synopsis: Fresh produce goes to waste because it's too small, slightly yellow from sunburn or has tiny spots of leaf rub.

image.altText: A man and woman hugging in front of a for sale sign at a house

props.synopsis: Each generation has had its own unique struggles with first-home ownership. But which has had it the worst? Experts say it has little to do with smashed avo.Â

title.children: Lazy millennials to lucky boomers: The generational struggles with first-home ownership

image.altText: Graphic depicts author Han Kang looking serious in front of a historic photo of a tank

image.altText: A woman stands outside her house and looks at the camera.

image.altText: Antony Green and the ABC panel on Queensland election night 2024

title.children: De Minaur out of Vienna Open after semifinal loss

image.altText: Maddison Gay of Essendon reaches out to catch a ball with a chest mark

props.synopsis: With seconds left, Richmond's Caitlin Greiser had a shot at goal and the Bombers were able to avoid a score, leaving the banner Indigenous round game tied.

image.altText: Ty stands on a soccer pitch with soccer goal in the distance

props.synopsis: People often avoid the topics of death and cancer around Ty, but he doesn't ask them to.Â

title.children: Speaking about his mother's death helps Ty grieve, but people keep avoiding the topic

image.altText: A male hand holding a smoking cigarette, in front of dark background.

image.altText: A drone photo of a port in the Scottish city of Edinburgh.

title.children: Scottish city recommended to store new Spirit of Tasmania ships for years. How did it come to this?

image.altText: A poster on the wall of a doctor's surgery reads 'Keep Pathology Bulk Billed'

props.synopsis: Police have identified victims in 30 countries, including Australia, New Zealand and the United States.

image.altText: A whale shark swims in the open ocean surrounded by smaller fish.

image.altText: Teenage boy wrinkling forehead, in front of pale blue background.

image.altText: Pig in maternity ring with piglets suckling from her

props.synopsis: Australia's biggest pork producer has introduced a "maternity ring" for pigs giving birth, which the RSPCA hopes will allow the industry to phase out more restrictive confinement.

title.children: Pork industry creates alternative to controversial farrowing crates to protect piglets
